DOC.brief_summary: Two forms of pre and postoperative physiotherapy are compared in three cohorts of patients undergoing cardio-thoracic surgery: Minor thoracic surgery (biopsy), major thoracic surgery (lobectomy etc, open or VATS) and cardiac surgery
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Two Modes of Respiratory Physiotherapy in Cardio-thoracic Surgical Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Inspiratory force calibrated training is applied in a controlled randomized trial
DOC.criteria: cardiothoracic operation, informed consent reduced cooperation (such as psychiatric diagnosis), severe neurologic disease affecting respiratory function, alcohol or drug abuse at hospital entry, tuberculosis or other contagious lung infection, severe respiratory insufficiency SpO2 < 90 or blood pO2 <8 or rep.rate > 25/min at rest or supplementary oxygen required at home, cardiac pacemaker.
